result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael M Gallegos

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Michael M Gallegos in court, in custody.  Attorney Danuta Kurczewski in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Michael M Gallegos. 
Sgt. Friday sworn and testified.
Statements by ADA Kurczewski.
Court finds probable cause/defendant bound over to Br. 2
Per ADA Kurczewski - will file info consistent w/complaint
Atty. Slattery acknowledges receipt of info, waives reading and enters N/G plea
STC to be scheduled w/Br. 2
Statements by Atty. Slattery re: bond modification.
Statements by Court - Court denies bond modification - bond continued.
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Michael M Gallegos appeared via zoom, in custody.  Attorney Danuta Kurczewski in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty. Travis Slattery appeared in person on behalf of defendant.
Atty. Slattery indicates he will be representing defendant on this matter.
Complaint received, reading waived.
Statements by ADA Kurczewski re: bond.
Court orders 22CF216 bond to cover 22CF263 (bond to cover both files).
Atty. Slattery requests PH
Court continues matter to 8-11-2022 @ 10:30 AM - PH w/2575
